title: Zelensky says US and Ukraine will hold talks on ending the war next week in Saudi Arabia
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he would travel to Saudi Arabia on Monday and his team would stay on to hold talks with US officials. Meanwhile, the EU's 27 leaders on Thursday greenlit a plan drawn up by the European Commission that aims to mobilize €800 billion to "rearm Europe" against the perceived threat from Russia.

title: Macron tells Trump France is a 'loyal and steadfast ally' in NATO, then hits back at 'imperialist' Putin
summary: After the summit of EU leaders in Brussels to discuss European defense, Macron told reporters that Russian President Vladimir Putin 'is an imperialist who seeks to rewrite history.' Putin's response: 'There are still people who want to return to the times of Napoleon, forgetting how it ended.'

title: At pedophile former surgeon's trial, the painstaking, meticulous horror of the 'black notebooks'
summary: Prosecuted for 299 rapes and sexual assaults on patients, most of them minors at the time, Joël Le Scouarnec spent years recording his crimes and fantasies in diaries, which were presented at trial on Wednesday by the Vannes criminal court, in Brittany.

title: Trump backs off Canada and Mexico tariffs, claims 'tremendous progress' with Sheinbaum
summary: The pause, which lasts until April 2, came one day after the White House announced similar relief for automakers.

title: A weak Pope Francis releases audio message thanking people 'from the bottom of my heart' for their prayers
summary: The 88-year-old pope, who has been in Rome's Gemelli hospital for three weeks, has chronic lung disease and has been stable for three full days after suffering a pair of respiratory crises on Monday. The Vatican has given twice-daily updates on Francis' medical condition, but has distributed no photos or video of him since February 14.

title: Roy Ayers, godfather of neo-soul, dies at age 84
summary: 'The Godfather of Neo-Soul' was a leading force in introducing soul to jazz in the 1970s. He released nearly four dozen albums throughout his career.

title: 'Faced with Donald Trump's US, it's time for European preference in tech'
summary: Faced with the American offensive in all sectors of the economy, including tech, European leaders are looking for the best way to fight back, writes Alexandre Piquard in his column.

title: Ariane-6 launches first commercial flight with military satellite
summary: The European rocket has launched a CSO-3 military observation satellite into orbit. This first commercial mission is all the more important for Europe, against the backdrop of profound geopolitical disorder imposed by Donald Trump.

title: Kremlin remains cautious and discreet about Trump's promised rapprochement
summary: Washington's freeze of military aid to Kyiv is another success for President Putin. But Moscow remains cautious about its next move.

title: US holds unprecedented talks with Hamas as Trump steps up threats against Gazans
summary: Despite repeated pressure from the US president, talks on the second phase of the ceasefire are at an impasse.

title: 'By weakening the Atlantic Alliance, Trump is helping the Putin-Xi partnership'
summary: The fracture the US president is causing between the US and Europe is giving away points to Russia and China, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Germany's future coalition pledges to do 'whatever it takes' to boost flagging growth
summary: Berlin has acknowledged that its budget rules are no match for the double danger facing Germany: A significant threat to its security, and also a serious risk of economic collapse.

title: Marine Le Pen timidly distances herself from Donald Trump
summary: After several weeks of silence, or even enthusiasm, regarding the actions of the new US president, Le Pen condemned the 'brutality' of the freezing of US aid to Ukraine.

title: Trump's tariffs, a new ordeal for the luxury goods industry
summary: The US is the leading market for luxury brands, the leading purchaser of French cosmetics and women's fashion, and ranks behind China for all leather goods manufacturers.

title: European court rejects bid to overturn Romania vote annulment
summary: Far-right candidate Calin Georgescu shot to prominence last November after unexpectedly winning the first round of Romania's presidential election last year amid claims of Russian interference.

title: Dismantling of temporary Paris courtroom that hosted landmark terror trials begins
summary: Inaugurated in 2021, the grant room on the Ile de la Cité courthouse hosted the trials for several terrorist attacks, including the November 13, 2015, attacks in which 130 people died. On Monday, a crew started dismantling it.

title: US measles epidemic: Vaccine or cod liver oil, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. leaves everyone free to choose
summary: Known for his anti-vaccination stance, the new US Secretary of Health is facing his first challenge: Curbing the mainly Texas-based measles epidemic which has been encouraged by low vaccination coverage.

title: Nazi salutes and anti-Semitism under investigation at French universities
summary: Since January 30, there have been five notable incidents of anti-Semitism at French universities, including Nazi salutes. Three investigations are underway in different places.

title: In Barcelona, the middle class are revolting against the housing crisis
summary: To prevent tenant evictions, the Catalan capital's town hall bought a building from an investment fund that wanted to turn the apartments into seasonal rentals. A symbolic operation, but a drop in the ocean as the city faces growing housing difficulties.

title: Cricket, a heated competition between India and Pakistan
summary: As Parkistan hosts the ICC Champions Trophy until March 9, the national team is the focus of criticism, following its repeated defeats. Many regret the heated level of sporting competition of yesteryear between the two 'best of enemies.'

title: Private US spaceship again lands awkwardly on the moon
summary: According to Intuitive Machines, the company's spacecraft, Athena, was not in the 'correct attitude,' or orientation, upon landing on Thursday.

title: The social problems plaguing Greenland, far from Trump's expansionist rhetoric
summary: The Danish island has many homeless people and one of the highest suicide rates in the world. Social issues are however virtually absent from the debates ahead of an election on March 11 that could be decisive for the territory's future status.

title: Musk's SpaceX faces new Starship setback after another fiery explosion
summary: SpaceX's Starship, the world's largest and most powerful rocket, exploded mid-flight for the second time on Thursday, its upper stage disintegrating over the Caribbean.

title: Over 70 killed in Syria clashes between government forces, Assad loyalists
summary: According to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, Thursday's attacks are 'the most violent attacks against the new authorities since Assad was toppled.' Islamist rebels led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham launched a lightning offensive that collapsed former ruler Bashar al-Assad's regime on December 8.

title: Denmark's spectacular shift from Atlanticism to European defense
summary: Fearing the destabilization of the transatlantic relationship on which its security policy was based, the Nordic country had historically avoided European defense integration.

title: China vows to 'firmly counter' US tariffs
summary: China's foreign minister issued a stern rebuke to the Trump administration as the US launched a new salvo in the trade war between the two countries.

title: Trains cancelled at Paris's Gare du Nord after unexploded WWII bomb found
summary: All traffic at Gare du Nord train station − including Eurostar services to London − was paused after a bomb dating back to World War II was found on the tracks.

title: Atlanticism, the alliance that gave structure to the Western world, is now in disrepair
summary: Founded in the name of common histories, destinies, and values, the North Atlantic Treaty Organization has existed since 1949. But with Donald Trump back in power, Euro-Atlantic solidarity can no longer be taken for granted.

title: Gisèle Pelicot's daughter files sex abuse case against convicted father Dominique
summary: Caroline Darian accused Dominique Pelicot of drugging her and committing 'sexual abuse' against her. He is currently serving a 20-year sentence for repeatedly sedating and raping Gisèle Pelicot with dozens of strangers.

title: South Korean court cancels arrest warrant of impeached president
summary: President Yoon Suk Yeol remained in detention even after the court's ruling, with the prosecution likely to appeal.

title: Europe decides to take its security into its own hands, without breaking with US
summary: At a European Council summit on Thursday, the EU adopted a €800-billion 'ReArm Europe' plan. But while some are calling for 'strategic autonomy,' other European countries are still counting on America's protection.

title: Trump backs down on tariffs amid Wall Street plunge
summary: The US president has postponed part of the tariffs on Canadian and Mexican products until April 2. The stock market's 'Trump bump' has now been totally erased.

title: Former French spy chief sentenced to prison in influence-peddling trial
summary: Bernard Squarcini was accused of using his security contacts for his own gain, including by obtaining confidential information for luxury giant LVMH. He plans to appeal.

title: Fashion trend: life in red
summary: The tone is set, and this bold color ignites the fashion world. Worn from head to toe, exclusively, with no room for half measures. A series by stylist Emmanuelle Alt and photographer Anthony Seklaoui.

title: US added 151,000 jobs last month, though unemployment up to 4.1%
summary: The unemployment rate went up by 0.1 points as the number of jobless Americans rose by 203,000.
